description: Two storey side to rear extension (following demolition of existing attached garage); single storey rear extension, part first floor rear extension; rear roof extension; installation of two roof lights to front roof slope; erection of front porch; single storey detached garden outbuilding for use as playroom/gym.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: Site location plan; 01 (Existing ground and first floor plans); 02 Rev. A (Existing and proposed side and front elevations); 03 Rev. A (Existing and proposed rear and side elevations); 04 (Proposed ground floor plans); 05 Rev. A (Proposed first floor plan); 06 Rev. A (Proposed loft and roof plan); 07 (Proposed outbuilding floor plan); 08 Rev. A (Proposed outbuilding elevations); 09 Rev. A (Proposed block plan) (revisions received 21.06.2021)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), the Norwood Green Conservation Area Management Plan and Appraisal (2007) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policy 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policy D4 of the London Plan (2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| All proposed front roof lights shall be of the non-projecting Conservation Area type and shall be installed flush with the plane of the roof and shall be retained as such thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of ensuring a high quality of design that preserves or enhances the character and appearance of the Norwood Green Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021).

| The detached outbuilding hereby approved shall only be used for purposes incidental and ancillary to the enjoyment of the dwelling on this site and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation including the installation of any bathroom facilities, kitchen facilities or cooking equipment.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, a Tree Report and Tree Protection Plan for the proposed works, specifying the method of tree protection shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing on site. This shall include details regarding the outbuilding foundations, methods of root protection during construction, and the extent to which the crown of the tree will be altered.
Reason: To ensure the preservation of protected trees.
